name: Voice for Performance
title: SoC GEN_CMN 110-0-20 Voice for Performance
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Theatre majors who are freshmen or sophomores
Add Consent: Department Consent Required
subject: GEN_CMN

overview_of_class: The focus of this class is on the development of vocal technique for the performer through work on relaxation, body alignment, breathing, vocal placement, resonance and exploration of the sounds of English using the IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet).  Individual vocal problems are analyzed and remedial work prescribed.  As vocal skills develop the focus will include connecting the speaking voice to the sounds of English and their relationship to meaning through the use of poetry and selected text.  Final will consists on bringing all the elements covered in the class together for a group performance of selected poetry performed on the stage.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The focus of this class is on the development of vocal technique for the performer through work on relaxation, body alignment, breathing, vocal placement, resonance and exploration of the sounds of English using the IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet). Individual vocal problems are analyzed and remedial work prescribed. As vocal skills develop the focus will include connecting the speaking voice to the sounds of English and their relationship to meaning through the use of poetry and selected text. Final will consists on bringing all the elements covered in the class together for a group performance of selected poetry performed on the stage.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Voice for Performance by Linda Gates with accompanying double CD.
Cambridge English Pronouncing Dictionary
Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats by T.S. Eliot
